title: Putin Finds a Growing Embrace on the Global Stage
summary: Eurasian leaders eagerly met the Russian leader at a summit this week, as President Trump has helped ease his isolation over the war in Ukraine.

title: Russia Suspected of Jamming GPS for E.U. Leader’s Plane, Officials Say
summary: The Bulgarian authorities believe that Russia disrupted navigation signals that would have been used by a plane carrying Ursula von der Leyen, European officials said.

title: Trump’s D.C. Crime Crackdown Shows Administration’s Uneasy Relationship With Guns
summary: If President Trump’s actions were intended to drive a law-and-order wedge between Democratic big-city leaders and their constituents, it has also exposed a division in his own coalition.

title: Crime Festers in Republican States While Their Troops Patrol Washington
summary: Republican governors who have mustered National Guard troops for deployment in blue-state cities may re-examine their deployments if federal intervention significantly brings crime down.

title: Trump Orders Have Stripped Nearly Half a Million Federal Workers of Union Rights
summary: The president, who has targeted collective bargaining contracts for nearly one million government employees, has said their functions touch on national security.

title: Trump Family Profits Even With Tepid Launch of Crypto Tokens
summary: World Liberty Financial’s cryptocurrency token fell short of investors’ hopes. But a previous deal paved the way for a payment to the Trump family of potentially hundreds of millions of dollars.

title: Nadler, Pillar of Democratic Party’s Old Guard, Will Retire Next Year
summary: Representative Jerrold Nadler, the ex-House Judiciary chairman who helped lead President Trump’s impeachments, will not seek re-election in New York.

title: Sophie Cunningham Avenged Caitlin Clark. Now Sponsors (and the Right) Love Her.
summary: The W.N.B.A.’s Sophie Cunningham is riding her viral moment to endorsements and brand deals. But she doesn’t want to talk politics.

summary: The world’s largest food company named Philipp Navratil, a longtime employee, to replace Laurent Freixe.

title: Rudy Giuliani Released From Hospital After Car Crash
summary: Rudolph W. Giuliani was injured Saturday night when the vehicle he was riding in was rear-ended on a New Hampshire highway.

title: When the Trumpeter Plays Taps, the Crowd at the Shore Goes Silent
summary: As the sun sets on another summer, John Hersh is wrapping up his 10th year of rooftop serenades.

title: In Brooklyn, West Indian Parade Celebrates Heritage and Carnival
summary: Revelers crowded Eastern Parkway for the 58th annual West Indian American Day Parade, known for its elaborate floats and costumes.

title: N.Y.C. Mayoral Rivals Make a Pivotal Stop at West Indian Day Parade
summary: The parade on Labor Day marks the beginning of a two-month sprint to Election Day, as Assemblyman Zohran Mamdani’s rivals try to narrow his lead.

title: Afghanistan Earthquake Leaves More Than 800 Dead
summary: The quake, near the border with Pakistan, injured more than 2,500 people in mountainous areas that rescue workers took hours to reach.

title: Searching the Rubble After Afghanistan’s Deadly Earthquake
summary: Hundreds of people were killed and at least 2,500 others were injured in a difficult to reach mountainous region. Officials warned many more people may still be awaiting rescue.

title: What to Know About the Earthquake in Afghanistan
summary: Hundreds of people were killed and more than 2,500 were injured, according to the Taliban government, and the death toll was expected to rise.

title: The Unchecked, Unbalanced Reign of King Donald
summary: Is our vaunted system really safe from the shameless likes of Trump?

title: We Ran the CDC: RFK Jr. Is Endangering Every American’s Health
summary: Agency leaders sound the alarm.

title: N.Y.C. Man Is at Least Fourth Person to Die in Custody in Just Over a Week
summary: A Turkish-born pedicab driver who was arrested on Friday night was found unconscious and unresponsive in a police station house cell. He later died at Bellevue Hospital.

title: Gene Espy, Pioneering Hiker of the Appalachian Trail, Dies at 98
summary: In 1951, he became the second person known to have walked the trail in a single trek — a “thru-hike” — covering some 2,000 miles from Georgia to Maine in 123 days.

title: Labor Day Protests Denounce Trump While Supporting Workers
summary: The demonstrations were part of the continuing effort by Trump opponents to try to pressure his administration, even if many events were modest in size.

title: Boy Shot and Killed After ‘Ding Dong Ditch’ Prank in Houston
summary: The police in Houston detained a person after an 11-year-old boy was shot on Saturday night, officials said.
